title: The world beyond what we see | Hilary Lawson, Hannah Dawson and Matthew D'Ancona
description:
Is there more?

Looking for a link we mentioned? It's here: https://linktr.ee/philosophyforourtimes

Many despise the arrival of a post-truth world and fear politicians who blatantly manipulate facts and peddle falsehoods. But does this rely on assuming that truth is objective and falsehoods can be simply identified? Does the demise of truth mark the end of centuries of progress? Or is truth a construct of the powerful and post-truth a revolution against elites?
